result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy R Bateman

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 11:45 AM: Defendant Timothy R Bateman in court, in custody. Attorney Emma Blankschein in court on behalf of Attorney Morgan Rae for Timothy R Bateman. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Scott Schaut sworn in for testimony. Direct examination by DA Leusink. Witness identifies the DE in the courtroom. Cross examination by Atty Blankschein. Witness excused @ 11:57 AM. The Court finds probable cause does exist. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Atty Blankschein requests a seperate date for Arraignment as she is not the attorney of record on this case. Bond modification argument by Atty Blankschein. Bond modification argument by DA Leusink. The Court will not modify bond at this time for reasons stated on the record previously. Arraignment scheduled - NOH given.
Arraignment scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 11:45 am.
